stakeHolders.name: Vendor
stakeHolders.description: Vendors who develop and support SNOMED CT-enabled systems.

kpas.name: Scope of SNOMED CT Implementation
kpas.description: The breadth of SNOMED CT integration across relevant clinical and administrative domains.

levels.name: Level 1
levels.description: SNOMED CT is used in only a few isolated areas.
questions: Is SNOMED CT used in only a few clinical modules?
Are clinical areas mostly using free-text documentation?
Is there no clear strategy for expanding SNOMED CT use?

levels.name: Level 2
levels.description: Initial adoption in several clinical modules, but use is inconsistent.
questions: Is SNOMED CT implemented in multiple modules but not consistently?
Are there gaps in the use of SNOMED CT across workflows?
Are some clinical areas still not using SNOMED CT?

levels.name: Level 3
levels.description: Widespread use across clinical areas with structured processes.
questions: Is SNOMED CT used consistently in most clinical areas?
Are there documented processes for using SNOMED CT?
Is SNOMED CT integrated into clinical documentation workflows?

levels.name: Level 4
levels.description: Seamless integration across clinical and administrative functions.
questions: Is SNOMED CT integrated across both clinical and administrative areas?
Are there defined protocols for ensuring consistent use of SNOMED CT?
Is SNOMED CT used for reporting, billing, and decision support?

levels.name: Level 5
levels.description: Fully integrated with continuous improvements and advanced use.
questions: Is SNOMED CT fully integrated with real-time updates and advanced analytics?
Is there continuous evaluation and improvement of SNOMED CT use?
Are new clinical domains and use cases regularly identified and integrated?

stakeHolders.name: User Organization
stakeHolders.description: Organizations that implement SNOMED CT within clinical settings.

kpas.name: Governance and Strategy
kpas.description: Establishing governance frameworks and strategic planning for SNOMED CT adoption.

levels.name: Level 1
questions: Is there no formal governance structure for SNOMED CT adoption?
Are implementation goals unclear or undocumented?
Is there no dedicated team for overseeing SNOMED CT implementation?

levels.name: Level 2
levels.description: Basic governance structures exist but are inconsistent.
questions: Are governance practices present but applied inconsistently?
Are there occasional governance meetings without clear outcomes?
Is there a lack of documented processes for SNOMED CT governance?

levels.name: Level 3
questions: Is there a documented governance framework in place?
Are governance practices regularly reviewed and followed?
Is there a clear strategy for SNOMED CT adoption?

levels.name: Level 4
levels.description: Comprehensive governance aligned with organizational priorities.
questions: Is governance aligned with organizational priorities and goals?
Are governance meetings held regularly with documented outcomes?
Are stakeholders actively involved in governance processes?

levels.name: Level 5
questions: Is governance continuously improved based on feedback?
Are strategic goals dynamically updated to align with new initiatives?
Is there a proactive approach to managing SNOMED CT adoption?

stakeHolders.name: Member
stakeHolders.description: SNOMED International Members managing national SNOMED CT adoption.

kpas.name: Growth and Adoption
kpas.description: Increasing the adoption and use of SNOMED CT within national healthcare systems.

levels.name: Level 1
questions: Are there few or no affiliates actively using SNOMED CT?
Is SNOMED CT adoption not tracked across healthcare settings?
Is there limited awareness of SNOMED CT at the national level?

levels.name: Level 2
questions: Are there initial efforts to promote SNOMED CT adoption?
Is adoption uptake inconsistent across different sectors?
Are there challenges in engaging affiliates to adopt SNOMED CT?

levels.name: Level 3
levels.description: Adoption metrics are tracked with national strategies.
questions: Are adoption metrics being tracked consistently?
Is there a national strategy for promoting SNOMED CT adoption?
Are affiliates regularly engaged to support adoption goals?

levels.name: Level 4
questions: Is SNOMED CT adoption consistent across multiple healthcare sectors?
Are national adoption goals being met and reviewed?
Is there widespread awareness and use of SNOMED CT?

levels.name: Level 5
levels.description: Continuous monitoring and identification of new use cases.
questions: Is SNOMED CT adoption continuously monitored and improved?
Are new use cases for SNOMED CT regularly identified?
Is adoption strategy dynamically updated based on feedback?
